Reviews.Title: “Cementery”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My experience at this hotel was the worst I have ever had. The room we got smelled as a cementery. I have never been in a room so humid as this one. The AC was dropping and the carpet was wet. We stayed there for one night. Never ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the hotel...You get what you paid for!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are on a budget, and need a clean, place just to lay your head down at night, the Regency is the place to go. For $89 a night, you get what you paid for, and a little more. My husband, 8 month old son and I stayed at the Regency Hotel this past October from Oct 15-Oct 19, 2004. We arrived in PR pretty late, at 1:30am 10/16. The staff was pleasant and courteous. I called the Hotel to make sure we had a late check in the day of Arrival and we had no problems what so ever. Once we arrived at the hotel, they upgrade us to a Suite on their own accord. I asked for a crib and they had one sent up immediately. Though the pool was nothing much to speak off, it really didn't matter when you can use ALL of the amenities at the Wyndham Condado Plaza Hotel and Casino that is right next door to them. I think to many people are expecting 4 star service when it clearly states it is a 2 star hotel that is meant to go if you are on a budget. Will my family and I stay there again on our next visit to Puerto Rico? Yes we most definitly will...Personally, all my family and I did was sleep, and bathe in the hotel room...and both the room and bathroom (w/great water pressure I may add) where clean, the bed was pretty comfortable. What more do you want?!! If you want a 5 star Hotel, then this is definitely not the hotel for you....But if you just want to lay your head down to sleep at an affordable price, I would go with the Regency.

Reviews.Title: “Extreme Letdown”
Reviews.Author: Boyd1944
Reviews.Content: This hotel was found on the travelocity website and was supposedly a Four Star listed hotel. It should be listed as a NO STAR hotel. Our flight arrived late into San Juan as scheduled. We arrived at the hotel at 11 PM. The Doorman/Bellhop watched us struggle our luggage from the taxi cab to the counter. The desk clerk stated "You finally arrived!". The lobby/reception looked run down. The clerk said to "sign here and your room number is so and on second floor". The doorman/Bellhop was now out smoking, so we got our luggage, took the elevator to the second floor. We could not locate our room as indicated on the key. My wife went down and ask which room? "Oh, it is 211. The number on the key is a code number in case it gets lost"!. We get into the room and the only light that worked was the ceiling light. The night stand lights did not have bulbs in them. The room air conditioning was leaking water out of the ceiling, we believe due to the humidity. There were no towels in the bathroom. We tried to turn on the TV to see how the election was going and the TV would not work either. We called the front desk and told them of the problems. In 10 minutes a maintenance man and a security guard showed up with light bulbs and towels. We "crashed" into bed rather late. The next morning, we went down for the listed "free" Continental Breakfast. The breakfast area was in a "dead end" hallway leading to the back of the hotel. The breakfast consisted of only coffee (instant), white bread/toast, jam, a few (limited) pastries. There was no fresh fruit or cereal or even juice. We asked at check out for a member of management to file a complaint/refund and the clerk said there was no one in yet. We could not wait due to flight connections for our trip. Travelocity is wrong for listing such a terrible hotel. The hotel should be shut down.

Reviews.Title: “We got our money's worth!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from October 19-26,2004. After reading some of the reviews, we arrived somewhat apprehensive, wondering what kind of mess we were getting into. To our surprise we ended up with excellent accommodations: a suite with a full kitchen and large refrigerator, king size bed and large, living-dining area. This is a no frills hotel, but with access to all the conveniences of the Wyndham Hotel next door. Do not let the modest looking lobby discourage you. The service we received was excellent and the location is great, with good access to the major throughfares.

Reviews.Title: “Strictly Second-Rate”
Reviews.Author: Barracuda30
Reviews.Content: We just got back from PR, where we stayed at the Regency from 6-20 August 2004. While I got a great rate online, the old adage "You get what you pay for" applies. My number one complaint is No internet access. Not through the room phone via dialup (probably because they use Sprint as their carrier, which is a lousy service and ***** for internet dialup. They used to have internet access through the room TV, but discontinued the service months ago. If you are on a business trip, what good is it if you can't get online? USELESS. I was very frustrated by this. I brought along my laptop but couldn't get online. Complaint number two: Like most hotels in Puerto Rico, they charge you daily for parking. I have only encountered this in Puerto Rico. If you are a paying guest at the hotel, I don't feel you should be charged for parking at all. It's only $5 a day, but bothersome and onerous. It's like they are nickel and diming you to death. Parking in San Juan is dog-eat-dog. It's a jungle out there, and parking spaces at a premium, but they should not charge parking to their guests. Complaint number three: No coffee makers available in the room, and if you want an iron or hair blower or small fridge you have to call housekeeping and ask for one. They do offer a complimentary continental breakfast on Floor 1 between 7AM-9AM, but if you miss it, too bad. On the positive side, Regency guests are allowed to use the pool next door at the Wyndham Condado Plaza Hotel and Casino, (the Regency has a small one on Floor 1) but once you see THAT place you'll realize what you passed up in quality in order to save money, not just in terms of the pool but also the hotel. The Condado Plaza pool has a swim-up bar and water slide. The Regency Hotel pool is just a pool. In fairness, I must say the employees and staff of the Regency were very polite, the hotel is centraly located, and there are plenty of restaurants. One caveat: Stay away from the Puerto Rico casinos, very, very hard to win here. The slots have a 93% payout rate (LOW). You can do better in Vegas or even Atlantic City if you're a gambler.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go there again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The regency looked okay from the outside but once you enter its like a old dungeon. One of the staff member was extremely polite and customer friendly, but the others made false promises. For example, we called for an iron and it took two days to get to our room, they provided no wash cloth we had to walk to Walgreens and buy some, on top of that the hotel only had two towels per room. The state of the hallways, rooms and what they call a pool was dispicable. The only mentionable thing about staying there was that they allowed you to use the Wyndham pool (magnificent). The hotel room stunk the carpet and bathroom was filthy they had to move us to a different room which was not much better because the toilet overflowed. I would not stay there again it makes more sense to stay at a reputed hotel for an extra buck and a peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: “Last Review got it right”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The last reviewer got it right, however was too kind. We got a good deal on Hotwire as well thinking one night at a two star hotel couldn't be that bad. Rundown hotel, with very marginal appointments, bed and bathrooms. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “If you're on a tight budget, then it's ok, otherwise.....”
Reviews.Author: djcrooks
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Regency for 1 night recently. I admit that I got a good deal on Hotwire, but this time I lowered my standards and took a lesser quality, 2 star, hotel thinking, "It's only for 1 night, it can't be too bad." I was right. For 1 night only, it wasn't horrible, but I would not recommend staying there for a vacation, unless you don't mind rooms that open to the outside, very old bathrooms with condensation dripping from the ceiling and carpet scary to walk on with bare feet. The building is in the shape of a "T" and there is a hallway across the front of the building, but it's open at one end and rooms down the side open to the outside. I could easily hear the group of kids in the room next door until late. The lobby is barren. Even if both elevators are working, expect to wait a long time because they are terribly slow. If you're like me, and look for good rates on Priceline and Hotwire and don't really care which hotel it is, as long as it's nice, then stick with the 3 stars and up hotels in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Regency through an online discount service that doesn't reveal the name of the hotel until after booking. Before arriving, we read and were encouraged by several of the other reviews above, despite the low star ranking. Upon arriving however, I was quite disappointed to see that the sagging old building with peeling paint and mildew stains was to be my accomodation for the next four days. The building and decor are severely dated. Our first room was ocean view but it was very damp (even the pillows were moist and the walls were sweating) and moldy. The carpet was old, ripped and stained, the chair had a burned out hole in it, and the bed covers smelled awful. The staff did what they could to reaccomodate us, however, and we were given a different room. Please note, the first floor is not great, but it is far better than the other levels. Our new room was better but smaller and located right in front of the breakfast area, which gets quite roudy with kids in the mornings. The continental breakfast, by the way, consists of coffee, bread and danishes. All in all, it was a roof over our heads, not a place I would stay at ever again. The only highlights were that the staff was nice and the Wyndam facilities are available next door. Do yourself a favor and pay a little bit more for a better stay. (by the way, the pool looks nice, but noone uses it, which could be good and bad.)

Reviews.Title: “The hotel with excellect STAFF”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From start to finish everything was great. We stayed 14 nights at the hotel. The staff was very friendly. resturant in hotel has been closed for a while thou. You can used all the fac. at the conado plaza hotel .... cool... You get what you pay for. And from the staff too.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: cbr600girly
Reviews.Content: I just got back yesterday from the Regency. The hotel was NOT all that, but what can you expect w/ such a good deal in pricing. Overall, I can say I definitely got my money's worth and it was worth it. The pool was great and the view of the ocean from the pool was great. Although if you are planning to visit Isla Verde or Old San Juan you're better off staying over there. Cabs were at least $12 each way w/out tip.

Reviews.Title: “Needs serious remodeling..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The ONLY 1 good thing about this hotel is the location - it is located in the Condado area of San Juan, and located next door to the Wyndam Condado - which you have access to at the pool, casino, etc. I have read many reviews and prayed nothing would go wrong but my husband is more positive that I am so we stayed at the Regency - the price was right and since we stayed 5 nights and got 1 night free-we tried it. If you just need a place to rest your head, stay here - this MIGHT be the place for you. If you have a car - $5 per day. Positives: Staff is friendly and helpful, hotel is located next door to the Wyndam, balcony in the room with views, price was right for us since we did not want to spend a lot of money per night. Negatives: rooms smell of mildew, our toilet flodded day 2 -but we were switched to another room, whole hotel needs remodeling. Stay here at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Regency Hotel, Condado.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were in the Regency Hotel from 05/07/04 to 05/12/04. We had a great time. The hotel upgraded us to a suite and we got a spectacular view of the ocean. The service was courteous and fast. Our balcony door was jammed and could not be opened. It was attended to promptly. The Wyndham is next door and all facilities can be availed from there including the pool and tours.The only disdavantage was that the beach (isle verde) is quite far. But old san juan and the beaches are readily accessible with a 25c bus ride (not after 9.00 pm though when the party begins in old san juan!). For the price we paid we got what we deserved. I have been reading reviews of a lot of people on this web site. Some poeple dont realise that they are actually leaving their home and going for a visit and expect the world from a hotel/bar or restaurant. Issues like mosquitoes nets, expensive food, harassing locals, chipped walls are all part of the travel experience. Get over it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Regency”
Reviews.Author: Nicki61
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Feb. 04, 1 night before our cruise and 2 nights after the cruise. We were alittle worried because some of the reviews we had read weren't the greatest. But we decided we would stay here the 1st night and then decide whether to stay here the other 2 nights we were planning. We were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. It is not new, it is not all that fancy. But the rooms are huge, the bathrooms huge and everything was very clean. We had a balcony that over looked the pool and ocean and the porch/walkway overlooked the cruise ships. We were very happy here. It is located very close to many restaurants and we could use all the amenities of the Condado next door. With the price at $150 night we felt this was one of the better values in SJ. We spoke to other people that had stayed in the best western and hated it, there was so much wrong i think they got all their money back! Not here...the staff couldn't be nicer or more helpful. After our cruise was over we headed to the hotel and they held our luggage for 3 hours while our rooms were getting clean. There are frigs in the rooms, phones, tv, desks 2 soft comfy chairs. Really this is a very nice hotel. Enjoy your self here, and don't be nervous.

Reviews.Title: “really great of the two we tried”
Reviews.Author: spacedog
Reviews.Content: went w/ my BF in february. we stayed at the san juan beach hotel the same week, and much preferred this hotel. although the lobby's a bit severe, this hotel had a good parking lot, great air conditioning, a great bed, great bathrooms, great towels, and good service. also, the other hotel was extremely damp, so staying at the regency was a great relief. it's just a few blocks further from the beach than some of the other hotels, but it's a pleasant walk so we didn't mind, plus it's a tad bit closer to old san juan (a 5 minute ride by bus).

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back there”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent there 9 days wuith my family (4), our rooms were clean, large with a balcony above the ocean. I wish i'll be back there when returning to PR. Breakfeast was rather good but the room is too small.

Reviews.Title: “Regency Hotel- A.k.A. A DUmp”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on your website we thought the hotel was worth a try for two evenings. Unfortunently the hotel is terrible. The staff does not know a thing about San Juan. The resteraunt in the hotel has closed. Although containing a view of the beach there is no part to swim on near by. The breakfast was gross. The rooms were dark and haunting. After staying the next few nights of our trip at the Hyatt in Dorado you see a major difference when you get out of San Juan. It is much nicer and the people become more friendly. Only stay here if you are in a bind but under our impression it looks like Wyndham will be taking over shortly. (Due to the run down of hotel, and using facilities of Condado Plaza Next Door.) IF you have room for a meal try Cobia at the Condado Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: beepet
Reviews.Content: I just got back today. The Regency is probably the cheapest hotel in the Condado area. Our room was clean. It was a little humid, but I'm sure everything is, that close to the ocean. The continental breakfast had pastries that were good. The only bad thing is that the elevators are slow, and there is usually only one working at a time. Be prepared to be patient or walk. At $115 a night, it was a good buy for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back yesterday and I stayed at the Regency for 4 nights. We had a great view of the lagoon and Condado city area. In addition, we had access to the Condado Plaza's facilities next door. That was the greatest plus - using the same facilities and paying half the price. It is 5-10 min. from Old San Juan and there are many restaurants and shops nearby on the strip. Would def. recommend. Make sure to ask for a room with a balcony facing the lagoon!

Reviews.Title: “The Regency is great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We love the Regency! My husband and I were previously staying at the ESJ in San Juan (see "what a dump" for more details on that nightmare) and checked into the Regency halfway through our vacation. The room was lovely, with a sunny view of Condado Lagoon. The biggest perk was access to the Wyndham Condado Plaza next door, which we exploited completely - pools (with bar), beach, casino, restaurants, everything. The people at the Regency were wonderful and provided top-notch service. If not for the association with a pretty bad experience at the ESJ, I would most certainly return to the Regency.

HotelInfo.Name: Regency Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1005 Ashford Avenue, San Juan 00907, Puerto Rico
